content.description: A nice lil dyno problem in the riverbed. V dirty but probably fun. Reminiscent of the now closed Wonder Dyno at Thy Tanks. The grade is a total guess, yall get out there and give opinions.
content.location: About 100 ft downstream of the Mr. Bubble Boulder at Urban Assault.

climbs.name: Untilted AKA Mr. Bubble Sit Start

content.description:
Just a lil sit start to the classic Mr. Bubble Slab, about 7 feet to the right of the black knobby slab, and sit under the mini-roof. Start matched on an obvious pinch hold, do some footwork reminiscent of the McK classic of a similar name, move out left to some sharp-ass holds, and work your way up the ridge til you top out on the slab.

 It is unlikely that someone has climbed this before, because the river has been slowly eroding the base of the slab to reveal this mini-roof, but if so, please let me know. Excellent problem but sharp!

 The grade is approximate, please give opinions.
content.location: Downhill side of the boulder, near the river banks. Start in between the tree and the boulder, the pinch undercling block should be obvious.

content.description: This isn't one problem in particular, rather a collection of slabs across the main face of Mr. Bubble. Fun, easy slabs with varied holds and movement. A little tall but the landings are good.
content.location: The south face of the boulder

content.description: Climb the east arete, from a sit start (ass on the ground). One move wonder? Great texture and difficulty
content.location: East arete of the boulder, downhill from main trail

content.description: Awesome slab climbing on sharp, dark limestone. Look for the cool knobs! "Some of the best easy problems in A-town" --Jefe in Texas Limestone Bouldering.
content.location: At the most downhill corner of the boulder, right at the riverbanks, with a tree close to the wall.

content.description: A scenic free-standing boulder in the middle of the riverbed. Very aesthetic and inviting, but it'll require some cleaning. Imagine you follow the arete up and right from a sit start.
content.location: About 50 away from the Wander Dyno, about 100 ft downstream of Urban Assault.

content.description: A huge boulder just downhill from Urban Assault. If you're standing at the route Ladrone, look behind you. This boulder is characterized by very sharp rock and namesake bubbly knobs. Great easy slab!
